component_renderable.title: Component
component_renderable.description: Reusable, repeatable and nestable building blocks of the design system. Each component meets a specific UI need. Thet are rendered by the template engine.

@component.title: Component
@component.description: Required. The component ID as described in the design system. If the value is empty or not defined in the design system, the full object will be ignored and its children will not be rendered.

@variant.title: Variant
@variant.description: A variant ID as described in the component definition.  If the value is not defined in the components definitions, it will be ignored and the component will be processed normally.

@attributes.title: Attributes
@attributes.description: An attributes mapping with a special behaviour: always avaialble to the component template, even if missing from payload.

^(?!@).*$.title: Slots and props
^(?!@).*$.description: They will be injected into the rendering engine as template context.

slot_value.title: Slot value (any renderable)
slot_value.description: The payload root, the component slots, some templates variables, and the @content property can host any renderable value.

anyOf.description: A string is the simplest renderable
A list of renderables is also a renderable. Each rendered item is concatenated with a whitespace as separator.
Any scalar is a legitimate prop value.
Any scalar is a legitimate prop value.
Any scalar is a legitimate prop value.
Pairs of attribute key and attribute value.

anyOf.title: List
anyOf.description: Props can be a nestable list of value if there are no renderable inside.

anyOf.title: Mapping
anyOf.description: Props can be a nestable key/value mapping if there are no renderable inside. Useful for menu structures.

element_renderable.title: Element
element_renderable.description: The basic building blocks, which does not use the template engine, making it light and faster to render than a component. They are low level and not part of the design system.

@element.title: Element name
@element.description: Required. Any value will be processed, even if not existing in the target markup language. If the value is empty, the full object will be ignored and its children will not be rendered.

attribute_value.title: Attribute value
attribute_value.description: A single attribute value. They are rendered as key="value".

anyOf.description: The plain, usually expected, type for an attribute value.
Needed by some templates expressions which are manipulating numerical values. Casted into a string before rendering.
Array of strings and numbers. Concatenated before rendering, with single space character as separator

attributes_value.title: Attributes value
attributes_value.description: Pairs of attribute key and attribute value.

attachable_element_renderable.title: Attachable element
attachable_element_renderable.description: More strict than a regular element: any reserved property outside of @element and @content will be ignored. Used in the @attached property.

@element.title: Element name
@element.description: Required. Any value will be processed, even if not existing in the target markup language. If the value is empty, the full object will be ignored and its children will not be rendered.

@content.title: Content
@content.description: Only strings to prevent nested attachment.

template_renderable.title: Template
template_renderable.description: A jinja-like template.  Can host bubbable properties, but no scoped properties.

^(?!@).*$.title: Template context
^(?!@).*$.description: Variables which will be injected into the rendering engine as template context.

styles_property.title: Styles
styles_property.description: Scoped. A list of values which can be used additively to style an element from scratch or to override a the look of a component. Each value is a style option, a simple HTML classes typically scoped to a single CSS property. Mutually exclusive options are defined as "styles" in the deisgn system.

theme_property.title: Theme
theme_property.description: Scoped. A theme is also expected to alter the display of the nested content, until a new @theme is found. Careful, some design systems are applying the theme to the global display anyway.

local_variables_property.title: Local variables
local_variables_property.description: Scoped. The CSS variables to dynamically override, as defined in the design system. Added as a style attribute on the renderable root tag. Keys not defined in the design system will be ignored. Double dash prefix (--) can be ignored in the request.

library_property.title: Asset library
library_property.description: Bubbable. A library of CSS and JS assets, folloiwng the design systems library definition. Generates link and/or style element in the HTML head, and script element at the bottom of the HTML body. More powerful than using directly @attached because of advanced processing like dependecies mangament.

css.description: Keys are URL. Values are HTML attributes which will be added to the attached element.

js.description: Key are URL. Values are HTML attributes which will be added to the attached element.

dependencies.description: A list of libraries ID which will be attchced before the current library.

trans_property.title: Translations
trans_property.description: Bubbable. A mapping of translation for template's translatable text.

.+.description: Every key is a translatable value, according to the template. Every value is the current translation.

variables_property.title: Variables
variables_property.description: Bubbable.  A list of attachable elements. The CSS variables to dynamically override, as defined in the design system. Generate a <style> tag with all the collected CSS custom properties and their overriden values for the header.

\\S+.title: Scopes
\\S+.description: Every scope is an object with variables as keys. Keys not defined in the design system will be ignored. Values equal to default will be ignored.
